title: What Tech Pioneer Ping Fu's Divorce Taught Her About Pivots
description: The Geomagic founder learned after her husband left her how to be vulnerable.
author: Inc. Video
excerpt: The Geomagic founder learned after her husband left her how to be vulnerable.
text: SpeakersPing FuCo-founder of Geomagic Inc.Lauded as Inc. Magazine’s "Entrepreneur of the Year" in 2005, Ping Fu has emerged as a luminary in the technology sector. At the National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA), her pivotal role in developing the NCSA Mosaic software laid the groundwork for modern web browsers, including Netscape and Internet Explorer. Her contributions were also instrumental to the early open-source movement, notably influencing the launch of the Apache HTTP Server in 1995, which remains a cornerstone of modern web infrastructure. In her extensive board service, Ping Fu imparts strategic insights to both public and private sectors, holding positions on Live Nation Entertainment and Capstone Green Energy boards. Her expertise spans cybersecurity, AI, Fintech and Greentech, and advanced manufacturing, making her an invaluable asset. Fu's influence reaches the highest levels of leadership—she has advised President Obama, worked alongside Vice President Joe Biden on Middle Eastern diplomatic initiatives, and, for eight years, guided the UAE Prime Minister on government innovation, contributing to projects like Dubai’s Museum of the Future and World Expo 2020. Her business leadership has earned her numerous accolades, including the Outstanding American by Choice award from U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year, and a Lifetime Achievement Award from Business Leader Magazine. A prolific inventor with five patents and an influential author, her memoir, "Bend, Not Break: A Life in Two Worlds," became a New York Times bestseller.Aisha BoweFounder and CEO, STEMBoard; founder and CEO, LINGOAisha Bowe is the Founder & CEO of STEMBoard, a company recognized twice by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing in America. A serial entrepreneur, Aisha's journey, fueled by her experiences as a former NASA rocket scientist and future Blue Origin astronaut, led her to secure venture capital for her second venture, LINGO—a self-paced coding kit aligned with national learning standards. Aisha's narrative is characterized by resilience, innovation, and an unwavering pursuit of the extraordinary.

Speakers

Ping Fu

Co-founder of Geomagic Inc.

Lauded as Inc. Magazine’s "Entrepreneur of the Year" in 2005, Ping Fu has emerged as a luminary in the technology sector. At the National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA), her pivotal role in developing the NCSA Mosaic software laid the groundwork for modern web browsers, including Netscape and Internet Explorer. Her contributions were also instrumental to the early open-source movement, notably influencing the launch of the Apache HTTP Server in 1995, which remains a cornerstone of modern web infrastructure. In her extensive board service, Ping Fu imparts strategic insights to both public and private sectors, holding positions on Live Nation Entertainment and Capstone Green Energy boards. Her expertise spans cybersecurity, AI, Fintech and Greentech, and advanced manufacturing, making her an invaluable asset. Fu's influence reaches the highest levels of leadership—she has advised President Obama, worked alongside Vice President Joe Biden on Middle Eastern diplomatic initiatives, and, for eight years, guided the UAE Prime Minister on government innovation, contributing to projects like Dubai’s Museum of the Future and World Expo 2020. Her business leadership has earned her numerous accolades, including the Outstanding American by Choice award from U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year, and a Lifetime Achievement Award from Business Leader Magazine. A prolific inventor with five patents and an influential author, her memoir, "Bend, Not Break: A Life in Two Worlds," became a New York Times bestseller.

Aisha Bowe

Founder and CEO,
STEMBoard; founder and CEO, LINGO

Aisha Bowe is the Founder & CEO of STEMBoard, a company recognized twice by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing in America. A serial entrepreneur, Aisha's journey, fueled by her experiences as a former NASA rocket scientist and future Blue Origin astronaut, led her to secure venture capital for her second venture, LINGO—a self-paced coding kit aligned with national learning standards. Aisha's narrative is characterized by resilience, innovation, and an unwavering pursuit of the extraordinary.
